it.cnr.isti.thematrix.scripting.modules

Class BufferModule

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractMap<K,V>
      • java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Symbol<?>>
        • it.cnr.isti.thematrix.scripting.sys.SymbolTable
          • it.cnr.isti.thematrix.scripting.sys.DatasetRecord
            • it.cnr.isti.thematrix.scripting.sys.MatrixModule
              • it.cnr.isti.thematrix.scripting.modules.BufferModule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Symbol<?>>

    public class BufferModule
extends MatrixModule
    Module implements single-writer, multiple-reader buffering (with stream replication) between TheMatrix modules. The module is inserted whenever appropriate by postprocessing the module graph before script execution.
    The readers interface to the buffer via a BufferProxyModule, so they can be identified. Ordinary hasMore() and next() won't work here.
    Module name does not start with TheMatrix to underline that this module is NOT available in the programming syntax. Implements a circular buffer wit multiple read-from pointers in an array of record references, uses TheMatrix hasMore(); next() conventions. Does call the input when a reader is out of data, keeps each row in the buffer until all readers are part it. It currently checks, but may deadlock if the buffer space is overrun by one reader. Invariant: for the slowest reader, we have
    (reader=writer) pointers means buffer is empty, and reader location is invalid;
    writer=reader+bufferSizeMax-1 means buffer full; we waste one position this way, but it's safer.
    Note that we use the consumers List of MatrixModule in a non-standard way, to keep track of the receivers when calling their setAll().
    Notes: circular reference buffer; shall be constrainted to 2^i bufferSize; shall keep integer pointers; define internal methods to compare, round indexes, update/compute bufferSize;
    Shall delete a reference only if each reader called next() on it;
    Shall report if the buffer is overrun.
    Author:
    massimo
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • numReaders

        private int numReaders

      • Wpointer

        private int Wpointer
        Single index for writing in to the buffer; points to a free location in the buffer; grow from 0 to MAXINT, it is wrapped around at the buffer bufferSize when accessing the data. Invariants: Wpointer<=Rpointer[i]<=Wpointer+bufferMaxSize for any i.

      • Rpointer

        private int[] Rpointer
        Array of indexes, of bufferSize numReaders. They grow from 0 to MAXINT, wrapping around at the bufferSize of the buffer. Each points to the active (valid) location, unless it is equal to Wpointer.

      • leastRpointer

        private int leastRpointer

      • buffer

        private DatasetRecord[] buffer

      • bufferMaxSize

        private int bufferMaxSize

      • bufferMask

        private int bufferMask

      • input

        private final MatrixModule input

    • Constructor Detail

      • BufferModule

        public BufferModule(java.lang.String name,
            java.lang.String inputTable,
            int size)
        Constructor that builds a Buffer Module AND adds it to the module chain, assumes the module chain is already built by the neverlang parser. Will patch its source module, generate the necessary Proxy modules, link them to the buffer and to their receivers.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the BufferModule
        inputTable - Name of the input module we use as source (it also provides the receivers list)
        size - Size of the local buffer in number of records

    • Method Detail

      • bufferSize

        private int bufferSize(int caller)
        Compute the amount of valid data in the buffer for a specified reader

      • bufferWriterSize

        private int bufferWriterSize()
        Compute the number of buffer locations available for the writer.

      • mayWriteInBuffer

        private boolean mayWriteInBuffer()
        Check if the writer has space to write in the buffer. Called each time a reader is advancing with respect to the other ones, hence we need to get and buffer one additional data row.
        Returns:
        true if we have space.

      • stepRpointer

        private void stepRpointer(int reader)
        A method to update the length of the buffer after a read and return it. Will increment the given Rpointer and update the minimum value leastRpointer. Shall NOT be called if the Rpointer[i] == Wpointer. FIXME now done in an ugly, trivial way, has cost O(numReaders) at each mimimum stream change --> O(numReaders) worst case.

      • setup

        public void setup()
        Description copied from class: MatrixModule
        This method is invoked once by the interpreter, after the constructor, during the analysis of the input script. The purpose of this method is to setup the internal state of the module, so that the following modules in the script can safely access this module's data In this method, the programmer must invoke DatasetRecord.setSchema(DatasetSchema) with a proper DatasetSchema instance and any other internal state variables must be initialized to sane defaults. If this module has inputs, it is also supposed to invoke MatrixModule.addConsumer(MatrixModule) for each input module instance. Subclasses may implement this method in such a way that it may be re-invoked by MatrixModule.changeInput(MatrixModule) or MatrixModule.substituteInput(MatrixModule, MatrixModule) to re-setup the internal state of the module.
        Specified by:
        setup in class MatrixModule

      • exec

        public void exec()
        Description copied from class: MatrixModule
        this method has no longer a real purpose. It is invoked by the interpreter when all of the input script has been processed, for all modules in the script, in sequence.
        Specified by:
        exec in class MatrixModule

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Description copied from class: MatrixModule
        resets the internal state of the module: it restore the internal cursor to the first record of the dataset, and it restores any other variable to sane defaults.
        Specified by:

      • hasMore

        public boolean hasMore()
        Description copied from class: MatrixModule
        this method returns true until the dataset has reached its last record. When the last record is reached it returns false. This method is allowed to manipulate the internal state of the object, provided that two subsequent call to this method does not change any observable result (e.g., this method should not advance the internal pointer)
        Specified by:
        hasMore in class MatrixModule
        Returns:
        true until the dataset has reached its last record
        See Also:
        This method is not active, for the buffer we have a separate method which identifies the caller (a BufferProxyModule).

      • next

        public void next()
        Description copied from class: MatrixModule
        advances the internal pointer to the next record in the dataset. Implementors may choose to return an error if MatrixModule.hasMore() is false. When a module has been constructed and setup, this method should invoked at least once, before accessing the values pointed at (e.g. using MatrixModule.get(Object)).
        Specified by:
        next in class MatrixModule
        See Also:
        This method is not active, for the buffer we have a separate method which identifies the caller (a BufferProxyModule).
